topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Step 6A- Configuring the Provider Networks

section.p: After the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade cloud is fully deployed, perform the following tasks in the Horizon UI.
section.title: Create Provider Networks
section.p: Use the following steps to create a provider network. Or, see Creating and Deleting Provider Networks and Creating a Segmentation Range.

ol.li: Click Admin, then System, then Networks.
Click Create Provider Network button to create the provider network.
Add the VLAN ID range to a provider network.

Click Create Range to open the Create Segmentation Range page.
Complete the form as required.
Name - Enter the name of the segmentation range.
Description - Enter a free-text field for reference.
Shared - If selected, shares the range for use by all tenants.
Project - Select the tenant associated with the segmentation range.
Minimum Enter the lowest value of a range of IDs.
Maximum Enter the highest value of a range of IDs.
Click Create Segmentation Range to commit the changes.
Once the Provider network is successful, hit the network tab and create the necessary networks.

section.title: Create Networks
section.p: Use the following steps to create the required network. Or, see Creating and Deleting Networks.

ol.li:
Click Create Network button to start creating the network.
Note : Segmentation ID is the VLAN id that is intended to use for the network. For example, in the above diagram, we used 110 VLAN ID for the data network.
After the network is complete, click Create Subnet.
Complete the Subnet and Subnet Detail tabs.
